'''Deerling''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''シキジカ''' ''Shikijika'') is a dual-type {{2t|Normal|Grass}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Sawsbuck}} starting at [[level]] 34.

Deerling [[List of Pokémon with form differences#Deerling and Sawsbuck|changes its appearance]] depending on the current [[Seasons|season]]. However, this change in form does not occur after capture, unless it is present in the {{player}}'s party at the time of a season change. This applies to Eggs as well.
* When the month is January, May, or September, the season is {{DL|Seasons|Spring}}, and it becomes '''Spring Form'''.
* When the month is February, June, or October, the season is {{DL|Seasons|Summer}}, and it becomes '''Summer Form'''.
* When the month is March, July, or November, the season is {{DL|Seasons|Autumn}}, and it becomes '''Autumn Form'''.
* When the month is April, August, or December, the season is {{DL|Seasons|Winter}}, and it becomes '''Winter Form'''.

From [[Generation VI]] onwards, Deerling can be bred in any form at any time if the parent is of that form.

==Biology==
Deerling is a fawn-like Pokémon, most resembling a fallow deer. The upper side of its body is pink in the spring, green in the summer, orange in the autumn, and brown in the winter. It has a yellow patterned rim, and its underside is peach. It sports a yellow floral tuft on its head, and similar yellow coloration on the insides of its tapering ears. The tips of its limbs are colored black and its pink tail is small. It can change in appearance with the changing of the seasons. If it senses animosity, it hides in tall grass. It moves in herds as it is timid around humans. It dwells in sparsely populated areas, away from humans. It is herbivorous.

==In the anime==
[[File:Daniela Deerling.png|thumb|250px|left|Spring Form Deerling in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
[[File:Summer Deerling anime.png|thumb|250px|Summer Form Deerling in the anime]]
===Major appearances===
A herd of Spring Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW001|In The Shadow of Zekrom!]]''. Another herd appeared in ''[[BW002|Enter Iris and Axew!]]'', where {{Ash}} attempted to catch one; however, as he had not weakened it, the Deerling was able to deflect the [[Poké Ball]] and fled with the rest of the herd.

A Spring Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW012|Here Comes the Trubbish Squad!]]'', under the ownership of [[Daniela]]. It was used to battle against Ash and his {{AP|Pikachu}}.

A {{pkmn2|wild}} Spring Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW018|Sewaddle and Burgh in Pinwheel Forest!]]''. A {{AP|Sewaddle}} accidentally latched onto it with {{m|String Shot}}, startling the Deerling. This caused it to buck and thrash around wildly through the forest in an effort to get Sewaddle off, but this put Sewaddle in serious danger.

Ash saved two Deerling from falling off a cliff at the beginning of ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram]]''. In ''Victini and Zekrom'', the Deerling were in their Autumn Form, while in ''Victini and Reshiram'', they were in their Summer Form and Autumn Form.

Summer Form Deerling debuted in ''[[BW054|The Four Seasons of Sawsbuck!]]''. Ash and {{OBP|Robert|BW054}} followed one in order to find {{p|Sawsbuck}}.

A Summer Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW055|Scraggy and the Demanding Gothita!]]'', under the ownership of [[Katharine]].

===Minor appearances===
Deerling made brief cameo appearances as background Pokémon in many episodes such as ''[[BW003|A Sandile Gusher of Change!]]'', ''[[BW033|Iris and Excadrill Against the Dragon Buster!]]'', and ''[[BW034|Gotta Catch a Roggenrola!]]''. Many Trainers have been known to own Deerling, such as a Trainer seen in a flashback in ''[[BW004|The Battle Club and Tepig's Choice!]]'', where it was seen defeating {{AP|Tepig}} before it was caught by Ash.

[[Dino]]'s Spring Form {{DL|Dino|Deerling}} was used against {{OBP|Omega|BW039}}'s {{DL|Omega (BW039)|Patrat}} in ''[[BW039|Reunion Battles In Nimbasa!]]'' and won, allowing Dino to advance to the second round of the [[Club Battle]] tournament.

An Autumn Form Deerling appeared in the opening sequences of ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram]]'', while multiple Summer Form Deerling appeared in both movies proper. Two Summer Form Deerling were saved by {{Ash}} and [[Victini (M14)|Victini]] when they were in danger of falling off a cliff face.

A Spring Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW051|Lost at the Stamp Rally!]]'', where it was seen performing in a [[Pokémon Musical]] show.

Multiple Deerling appeared in ''[[BW059|Stopping the Rage of Legends! Part 1]]''.

A Deerling briefly appeared in ''[[BW071|Search for the Clubultimate!]]''.

A Deerling appeared in ''[[BW080|Clash of the Connoisseurs!]]'' as one of the Pokémon [[Burgundy]] disguised as Fauxgundy reviewed as a possible Pokémon for [[Marigold]].

Multiple Deerling appeared in ''[[BW085|All for the Love of Meloetta!]]''.

Multiple Summer Form Deerling physically appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]''. Multiple Deerling also appeared in their Spring, Summer, and Autumn Forms during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

A Summer Form Deerling briefly appeared in ''[[BW090|Jostling for the Junior Cup!]]'' and ''[[BW092|Ash, Iris and Trip: Then There Were Three!]]''.

A Spring Form Deerling briefly appeared in the {{OBP|elder|Village of Dragons}}'s flashback in ''[[BW100|A Village Homecoming!]]'', and also in one of {{an|Iris}}'s flashbacks in ''[[BW101|Drayden Versus Iris: Past, Present, and Future!]]''.

Two Summer Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW112|Team Plasma's Pokémon Power Plot!]]''.

A Summer Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW114|Saving Braviary]]''.

A Summer Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW117|Team Plasma's Pokémon Manipulation!]]''.

Multiple Summer Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW118|Secrets From Out of the Fog!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Deerling appeared in ''[[BW125|Cilan and the Case of the Purrloin Witness!]]''.

Multiple Summer Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW127|The Island of Illusions!]]''.

A Summer Form Deerling appeared in ''[[SS026|Mewtwo — Prologue to Awakening]]''.

Multiple Summer Form Deerling appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]''; two of them helped put a fire out at [[Pokémon Hills]].

A Spring Form Deerling appeared in a fantasy or a flashback in ''[[BW134|The Journalist from Another Region!]]''.

A Summer Form Deerling appeared in ''[[BW137|Celebrating the Hero's Comet!]]''.

A Summer Form Deerling appeared in a flashback in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]''.

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Deerling and {{p|Sawsbuck|its evolution}}.

===Origin===
Deerling is based on a {{wp|sika deer}} fawn.

====Name origin====
Deerling may be a combination of ''deer'' and ''[[wiktionary:yearling|yearling]]'' (referring to both its young age and its ties to the year's four seasons) or ''sapling'' (referring to its Grass-type and abilities). Alternatively, it may be a combination of ''dear'' and ''darling'', both common terms of endearment.

''Shikijika'' is a combination of 四季 ''shiki'' (four seasons) and 鹿 ''shika'' (deer).
